results.title: The Pyre of Triune
results.brief_description:
A paint-on-glass animation exploring personal themes of spirituality - representing a journey into the soul and the discovery of the spirit of god, a struggle for meaning and the light within.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 1997.

results.title: The Pyramids and cities of the Pharaohs
results.brief_description: Egyptologists and video artists takes us back 5,000 years to view the awakening of Egypt - a civilisation that created colossal structures with simple tools and massive manpower. Egypt is an amalgam of two things: the constancy of the Nile and the labour of its people. The reconstructions in this video recapture the splendour of Egypt including two of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, the Pyramids and the (Pharos) Lighthouse at Alexandria. Marvel at 25 historical recreations including the Temple of Luxor, Temple of Ammon at Karnak, Temple of Ramses, the Step Pyramid at Saqqra, and the Great Temple of Abu Simbel with its four statues of Ramses II.

results.title: The Pussycat that ran away
results.brief_description: Two boys spend the summer on a dairy farm in Norway. When one of them is unkind to the other his cat is so disappointed in him that he runs away. During the search that follows Eric learns a great deal including the importance of obeying his parents and of being kind to his brother.

results.title: The Pursuit of happiness; The Smile of reason
results.creator_credit: BBC, Michael Gill and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode numbers 9 and 10 of Series “Civilisation”.
Part 9. Sir Kenneth Clark reflects on the nature of 18th century music, from Bach to Mozart and on the architecture of that period. Part 10. Looks at the sensible, sophisticated men and women who met in the salons of 18th century Paris and became the precursors of revolutionary politics.

results.title: The Pursuit of happiness
results.brief_description: Young sales hopefuls Tony and Mary introduce us to self-proclaimed success story Danny, the manager of a door-to-door distribution company. His business philosophy inspires a cult like zeal in his sales team, who battle the hurdles of the working day. Danny is a model and mentor, but is his belief in greed enough? The Pursuit of happiness offers great comic relief in its view of a world where the only measure of success is winning the daily dash for cash.

results.title: The Pursuit of happiness
results.brief_description: This is set in Fremantle, Western Australia during the build-up to the America’s Cup Yacht Race and the controversy surrounding the visit of US nuclear warships. It is about human relationships and international issues, the threat of nuclear war and people’s attitudes to the future. The film blends scenes of fact and fiction to portray the story of a family in conflict and one woman’s growing awareness about the choices she must make.

results.title: The Purse
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Patricia Watson
results.brief_description: Deals with the conscience or the lack of it, and what one or the other makes us do. An elderly woman finds a purse on a bus. She takes it home and discovers it contains some money. The woman who lost the purse collects insurance. the quetsion raised is does circumstance excuse taking what is not ours.

results.title: The Purple turtle
results.brief_description: Illustrates the quality of the young child’s engagement with art activities. Designed to capture the excitement art activities offer to the kindergarten child rather than suggest a method of teaching. Presents situations and moments in which the child works with a variety of art material and techniques. Original music composed by Richard Wernick and integrated with children singing and a rhythm band.
